quiz.title: Comparing Rates of Change
quiz.subtitle: Unit 4.6: Analyzing Different Slopes and Their Meanings
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Slope Comparison, Steepness Analysis, and Real-World Context

questions.question: Which line is steeper: $y = 4x + 1$ or $y = -5x + 2$?
questions.explanation: Steepness = absolute value of slope. $|4| = 4$, $|-5| = 5$, so $y = -5x + 2$ is steeper.

questions.question: Car A travels 60 miles in 1.5 hours. Car B travels 100 miles in 2 hours. Which has greater speed?
questions.explanation: Car A: $60/1.5 = 40$ mph. Car B: $100/2 = 50$ mph. Car B is faster.

questions.question: Which function increases fastest as x increases?
questions.explanation: Compare positive slopes: 3 (f), 0.5 (g), 1 (k). $f(x)$ has largest positive slope (3), so increases fastest.

questions.question: Job A pays \$15/hour. Job B has the equation $y = 12x + 20$ where y = total pay, x = hours. Which pays a higher hourly rate?
questions.explanation: Job A: \$15/hour (slope = 15). Job B: slope = 12 (\$12/hour). Job A has higher rate.

questions.question: Compare drainage rates: Tank 1 loses 30 gallons in 2 hours. Tank 2 loses 40 gallons in 3 hours. Which drains faster?
questions.explanation: Tank 1: $30/2 = 15$ gal/hr. Tank 2: $40/3 â‰ˆ 13.33$ gal/hr. Tank 1 drains faster.

questions.question: Which line has the greatest rate of change?
questions.explanation: Line D has the steepest positive slope (rises fastest as x increases).

questions.question:
Compare the following phone plans. Which plan has a higher rate of cost increase per MB used?

Plan A: \$0.10 per MB
Plan B: \$5.00 fixed fee + \$0.05 per MB
options: They have the same rate of increase
It depends on the total MB used
questions.explanation: The 'rate of increase' is the slope (cost per MB). Plan A's slope is 0.10, while Plan B's slope is 0.05. Therefore, Plan A increases at a faster rate regardless of the initial fee.

questions.question: Company X grows by 200 customers/month. Company Y: $y = 150x + 1000$ (y = customers, x = months). Which grows faster?
questions.explanation: Company X: 200 customers/month. Company Y: slope = 150 customers/month. Company X grows faster.

questions.question: Which decreases fastest as x increases?
questions.explanation: For decreasing functions (negative slopes), compare absolute values: $|-4| = 4$, $|-2| = 2$, $|-1| = 1$. $y = -4x + 10$ decreases fastest.

questions.question: Town A grows by 250 people every year. Town B's population is modeled by $P = 180t + 5000$, where $t$ is years. Which town is growing at a faster rate?
options: They are growing at the same rate
Town B grows faster because it starts with 5,000 people
questions.explanation: Town A's rate is 250 people/year. Town B's rate (slope) is 180 people/year. Even though Town B starts larger, Town A is adding more people per year.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent comparison skills! You can analyze rates across contexts, compare absolute values, and interpret real-world implications.
scoreMessages.70: Strong analytical skills! Review comparing positive vs negative rates and distinguishing initial value from rate.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice: 1) Comparing absolute values for steepness, 2) Calculating unit rates, 3) Separating rate from starting value.
scoreMessages.0: Start with simple comparisons: Larger positive slope = faster increase. Larger |negative slope| = faster decrease. Calculate unit rates carefully.
